Document: # Lethal Force - Lethal force should always remain a last resort. - During emergencies such as mutinies and boardings, or against suspects who have used lethal weapons against personnel prior, the [color=#8B0000][bold]Chief MP[/bold][/color] or [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] may authorize lethal force. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] may use lethal force should suspects be an [bold]active[/bold] threat to the crew or ship. The suspect should only be fired upon until they can no longer present any harm. - A suspect that has been detained and restrained must be kept safe from harm, as they are in MP custody. - If the [color=#8B0000][bold]Chief MP[/bold][/color] and [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] are not responding to comms within a reasonable amount of time, or are incapacitated, [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] may use lethal force freely while on code red or higher. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] may use lethal force against targets that are uneffected by non-lethals, such as synthetics. - Synthetics must be given a chance to stand down, however must be repaired to serve its sentence once taken down.
